text: The Ambivali Caves, or Ambivali Leni, are a group of Buddhist caves near Neral, Raigad district, Maharashtra, 8km southeast of Kalyan. The caves are cut in the low hill located on the concave portion of a river. They consist in 12 viharas celles with verandah and several water cisterns. There is one inscription in Brahmi script on a verandah pillar. ==References== Category:Buddhist monasteries in India Category:Buddhist caves in India Category:Indian rock-cut architecture Category:Former populated places in India Category:Buddhist pilgrimage sites in India Category:Architecture of India Category:Caves of Maharashtra
